Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: We did initial work and smart contract in Ethereum. And switched to NEM because it's less costly than Ethereum and it's faster. We like it being APIcentric. And it comes with pre-built easy to implement components. One of the things we liked is the ability to n-thousand transactions per user in our own blockchain (zero cost of consolidation) and connect it to the main network only to send and consolidate certain information.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: We plan to implement a risk scoring system which tries to determine the likelihood of 3 things occurring if the bail is paid and the defendant released. We want to determine if the defendant is likely to fail to appear to court, if they are likely to commit another crime or if they are likely to commit a violent crime if released. The fees will be based on the risk. The plan is to keep the fees less than 3%. Token holders will determine which bail payment and the amount based on their tolerance for risk, the type of crime, the location, the amount of bail, etc. Take a look at the youtube channel http://youtube.com/c/mainpriseio for a couple of quick explainer videos.  There are other fees such as fees to participate in the prediction market, fees to utilize the risk scoring tools for other uses, fees to access data, fees for using the bail token kiosk, etc.

Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: When a person is arrest and provided bail. The bail payment is needed as "insurance" so the person will show up for their trial. When the person shows up to court for their trial, the bail payment is returned regardless if the person is innocent or guilty.  So the payment is made to the "government/jail/court" and it's returned back to the platform at the end of the case. And the tokens are returned back to the token holders.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: There are no guarantees. And there are no requirements to depositing anything each month. Reasons you should invest are:  If you believe the project will be successful. If you want to make contributions to help make bail payments. If you want to earn a small fee for helping pay someone's bail. If you want access to the APIs If you want to access the risk scoring tool. If you want to participate in the prediction market. If you want an opportunity to own a bail payment kiosk. If you want access to the big data and analytics.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: You earn fees by making micropayment contributions to help people's bail. In return, you'll earn a percentage or the fee paid by the applicant based on your contribution.  If the bail payment is $1000 and you contributed $100 and the fee is $30, you'll get you $100 refunded plus 1/10 of the $30 fee. Because you contributed 1/10 of the payment.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]

Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: There are lots of activity and initiatives to fix the broken commercial bail system. What's different here is we are starting with the "community" and getting "peers" to help "peers" without adding any additional costs to jails, detention centers, the government or taxpayers.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Thanks! Yes exactly, we are trying to make it easy and helpful for the community.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Thanks for the feedback.  Yes, making it easy to request bail payments, and easy for token holders to contribute. Plus using blockchain technology for transparency, accountability, security and a crypto.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: The difference here as opposed to other bail reform initiatives. We want to leave the decision on who gets bail and the amount in the hands of judges. So if a judge doesn't grant bail then there isn't anything we can do. Other initiatives are tackling those problems. Or if a bail amount is set too high, we aren't trying to get the amount lowered. Again, other initiatives are addressing those issues. We are simply trying to get the bail paid when and if it's set and regardless of the amount. It takes lots of resources and time to get laws changed. In the meantime, if we can just build a platform to get bail people, we can get people out of jail and home. While the bigger and broader issues are being worked out.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Once bail is paid, a person is released by the rules and regulations of the jail or detention center. There are various conditions and guidelines which differ depending on the jail or detention center. We will have guidelines defined as we develop the platform and integrate with jail systems.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: One of the major reasons we chose blockchain and a peer-to-peer implementation is to disrupt the current middlemen such as bail bondsmen, insurance agencies, and fugitive recovery agents. We are trying to level the playing field so get the middlemen out of the way, reduce fees, and provide better services in an open, trusted, secured environment.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Thanks for the positive feedback. Just getting started with the marketing. Stay tuned for a bounty campaign and airdrops. And a game which helps market the project.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Yes. It will take time. Lots of time to dismantle a system that has been in place for centuries. The concept of bail can be traced back to 399 BC, when Plato tried to create a bond for the release of Socrates. The modern bail system evolved from a series of laws originating in the middle ages in England. Right now the plan is to disrupt the key players in the current system using innovation such as blockchain, peer-to-peer and a cryptocurrency. We will make MAJOR impacts in the short term and get better as time progresses.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Yes, based on NEM. Which has security, accountability, transparency in its core. We switched from Ethereum recently. Because with NEM we aren't limited to solidity and can mix match and combine many different technologies via it's REST API. Plus combining Namespaces (unique domains), Mosaics (customizable assets), 2.0 multisig contracts, and three forms of messaging give an advantage. The architecture allows us to build the platform and applications for almost every operating system and device with the same degree of decentralization and security. Compared to Ethereum, NEM can scale to hundreds of transactions per second and has already been tested privately and independently to scale to thousands of transactions per second in the Catapult release. Lastly, we can easily integrate both public and private blockchains as we partner with jails and detention centers and help them move towards blockchain technology.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Thank you. And yes, this is a very long-term project. And the team is committed to its success.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Token holders decide which bail they want to pay via their preferences. So it's not the "person" arrested paying their bail. It's their friends and family requesting a bail payment on their behalf. Then the payment request is matched with token holders who are willing to make micropayments to help someone get out of jail.  You have to remember the person arrested hasn't been charged, so they are considered innocent. Yet, they are held in jail awaiting trial and in the meantime, they lose their job, can't pay their bills, can't take care of their family, etc. This could be someone arrested for driving with a suspended license because they forgot to notify the driver's license office of their new address.  Take a look at this video to see how it works for token holders: https://youtu.be/iY-DbpXXW1w

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Inside of blockchain technology, there are none we've found. Outside of blockchain, there are many competitors both directly and indirectly. 25,000 bail bonding agencies in the USA. Many insurance companies. And other companies facilitating bail payments. None are offering our core service which is peer-to-peer bail payments and none are offering our combined services from a single company such as risk scoring, court date notifications, the prediction market, independent kiosk ownership, professional fugitive recovery, and a cryptocurrency token.

Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Yes Token Holder will be able to automatically set preferences (risk score, type/level of charge, location, amount, and other factors) and the platform will match bail requests with token holder preferences before making the contribution. Or Token Holders can manually manage the contributions themselves from view open bail requests on the platform. The payments are returned once the person attends trial and meets other conditions for their release. The risk is low and spread across many token holders who make micropayment contributions towards the full bail amount.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: The core of the idea is to have people helping to contribute to making bail payments for other people. To eliminate bail bondsmen and insurance companies and their high fees, closed agreements, answer to no one approach. Token holders replace them and earn a fee in the process. This isn't for token holders to pay their own bail like Uber drivers don't join Uber to drive themselves. Uber drivers join Uber to drive other people who need a ride. The same as BAIL Token holders have tokens to help other people who need bail and token holders get a fee for helping. Makes sense?

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: https://i.imgur.com/H5FEsvU.png _______________________________________________________________________________    MAINPRISE  Mainprise Is Building a Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payment Platform On NEM Blockchain Technology. _______________________________________________________________________________    What Is BAIL Token?  BAIL Token is a platform for the future of bail payments that is being built on top of the NEM blockchain. It will enable peer-to-peer bail payments using a cryptocurrency token and will offer seamless integration with jail and detention center systems, bail payment kiosks, and Mainprise ambassadors.  Token holders are able to manually or automatically configure the platform to make payments based on their preferences. Payments are refunded regardless of the trial outcome and token holders earn fees based on the risk scoring of the defendants. Since payments are refunded and spread across many token holders the overall risk is reduced.  :: P2P Bail Payments :: AI-Based Risk Scoring :: Prediction Market :: Low Fees :: Bail Payment Kiosk :: Professional Fugitive Recovery   https://i.imgur.com/tojsVlt.png https://i.imgur.com/xkyIT5J.png https://i.imgur.com/DcgUL30.png  https://i.imgur.com/TsysJfx.pnghttps://i.imgur.com/lD6k6wu.png https://i.imgur.com/OnFi4eI.png https://i.imgur.com/fbOaqfe.png https://i.imgur.com/2A2bdUk.png https://i.imgur.com/JfBdndx.png https://i.imgur.com/mzVVX0g.png   If You're Interested In Joining Our Team As An Advisor, Please Contact Us.   https://i.imgur.com/kw0dNZL.png    https://i.imgur.com/wI5AsjI.png    https://i.imgur.com/3tjawcx.png  https://i.imgur.com/JC7kWkh.png    https://i.imgur.com/VLuTL9G.png    https://i.imgur.com/Kx9hsxi.png    https://i.imgur.com/epkPFTa.png    https://i.imgur.com/7Qld6sd.png   WEBSITE | EMAIL | WHITEPAPER | FACEBOOK | TWITTER | REDDIT | YOUTUBE | TELEGRAM

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: The team is still growing and expanding. In fact, we are looking for more team members with criminal justice backgrounds.  The idea came about in the midst of bail reform movements in the USA. And realizing blockchain technology at its core is intended to disrupt middlemen. So using blockchain technology to disrupt bail bondsmen and insurance company makes perfect sense. Other benefits such as smart contracts, transparency, accountability, and a cryptocurrency tokens make the idea even more viable. We haven't seen anyone else try to tackle this "problem" with the "solutions" were putting together. Take at look the whitepaper when you get a chance.

Author: alexanderthegreat2
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: What will be the main focus for you with the funds you will raise with the ICO?

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Not sure which customer you mean. I'll address the various actors:  1. Tokens holders trust will be gained by the use of a risk scoring tool prior to them contributing their token for bail. And a smart contract detailing the payments, fees, etc written to the blockchain.  2. Family or friends request bail trust will be built by having open agreement on the blockchain details the fees (if any) and other details.  3. Jails and detention centers trust will be built by integrating directly with their systems for payment, providing payment via kiosk in the lobby they allow to be installed or paying at the bail windows via fiat by a Mainprise ambassador.

Author: Seuwyes
Title: ðŸš€[ANN][ICO]Mainprise.io - Peer-To-Peer (P2P) Bail Payments - BAIL Tokens [NEM]
Body: Building the team, platform and marketing are all important. The most important is building a bail fund. This is the funding source of the bail payments. Token holders simply stake (or escrow) their tokens and the platform pays the jail or detention center fiat from the bail fund until wider acceptance is made and the jails accept BAIL Tokens. The courts refund the bail payment upon attendance of trail which goes back into the bail fund. And the tokens are release back to the token holders along with a percentage of the fee paid by the family/friend requesting a bail payment.
